sect2.title: Requirements
sect2.para:
You need the following packages (We assume you are on an Ubuntu Linux, for other platforms there are similar packages available. Some platforms may have only two monolithic packages to download, a 'wolframe' and a 'wolfclient' package):
wolframe_&WolframeVersion;-1_amd64.deb: the Wolframe core server
wolframe-sqlite3_&WolframeVersion;-1_amd64.deb: the Sqlite3 database driver module
wolframe-libxml2_&WolframeVersion;-1_amd64.deb: the XML filter based on libxml2
wolfclient_&WolfclientVersion;-1_amd64.deb: the Wolframe graphical user interface client

sect2.title: Sample application
sect2.para:
We want to manage a list of customers with name and address and provide the usual operations:
list all customers
create new customers
edit existing customers
view customer entries
delete customers
search for customers

sect2.title: Basic directory layout
sect2.para: We don't use the normal directory layout as it requires root rights to install.

Instead we create two directories, one for server data and one for client data:
mkdir ~/tutorial mkdir ~/tutorial/server mkdir ~/tutorial/client
